page.title: 11HISTORY - BALLYUTOAG SCHOOL
page.content: In 1874 a National school was built in the area. It was named Ballyutoag National School. It was built by the local landlord who was called the {Viscount Templeton.}Ballyutoag National School existed until 1935. Joined onto the National School was the headteacher's home. In the year 1921 the National School system came under the control of the new Northern Ireland Government. It was changed to an Elementary School. However, by the 1930's the number of pupils attending the school had fallen to single figures and so, in 1935, the school was closed. The old documents, rollbooks and files are still in the school. The people who live in the teachers house have never been in the school until recently as they had no key.
